reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Surely this hotel complex which also includes the Hof Ragaz must be one of the most fabulous resorts in the world. I give full five-star ratings to all the above six criteria because there simply is nothing to complain about - if you want real luxury and are prepared to pay for it, this is the place. We stayed at the new "Spa lofts" which leave nothing to be desired, once you have mastered the rather complicated lighting system. Spa treatment superb, food as well. If you do not want to eat the rather rich food at the "Bel Air" restaurant, there are several other restaurants within the "Grand Resort" and outside, i.e. in the Bad Ragaz village. Lovely countryside with two golf courses and some of Switzerland's best vineyards (do try the local red wine from Fläsch village). If you wish the spa treatment, try the "Vino Therapy", a real treat, but massages are excellent as well. In both piano bars, the pianists are excellent. We would definitely like to return to this resort but would probably choose a slightly cheaper accommodation, e.g. at Hof Ragaz, linked to the Quellenhof. Some of Switzerland's most famous ski resorts are very easily reached, either in your own car or by public transport. So is the Lake Constance but avoid the German side (Lindau) because of terrible traffic congestion. Bregenz (Austria) is okay.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Certainly the hotel complex was quite in this late hours but the reception gave us a personalized welcome service. We were accommodate in the traditional main building and we enjoyed the carful attention of the staff. They registered our preferred newspapers and any wish had been fulfilled. Very good laundry service, excellent breakfast and certainly no limit of spas and pools with high quality treatment service.
reviews.title: Healing oasis, great restaurants old style European elegance.

reviews.text: Stayed last december for two nights and again this month for only one night this time. Took our 16 months old daughter with us and were blown away by the service. Upon confirming the reservation, I received a questionnaire, asking what we would like in the room for our little toddler. When we arrived, we had a crib, a Stokke changing table with Penaten amenities, a diaper trash can, a baby bathtub, baby clothes hangers, a thermometer for the bath, and received a little stuffed animal all ready and waiting for us. Staff is extremely friendly and well trained. The even have a kids villa, where your child can be looked after.
reviews.title: Amazing again on the second visit

reviews.text: The renovation is now complete and the facilities are amazing, with 12000 square meters of Spa (including the Tamina Therme). Food & Beverage facilities are also amazing. Had dinner in the Italian restaurant, food was fabulous. Will definitely go again.

reviews.text: The room was big and very modern, drinks and snacks in the mini bar were included. High tech gadgets everywhere you looked. Air adjustable beds, two B&O tvs, modern lighting... and the bathroom topped it all. We had our little SPA right in our very own room.

reviews.text: There was a whirlpool bathtub for two, mood light changing colour, a shower with built in steam bath and a small private sauna. There was no need to leave our private room, we hat it all. As we had stayed in the Quellenhof before, we did not need to see the public spa area. We knew it is good anyway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew into Zurich, but our destination was the Dolomites. We were looking for a nice hotel not too far from the airport, on the way to Cortina. Our travel agent recommended the Grand Hotel Quellenhof in Bad Ragaz. Where??? We had never heard of the hotel OR the town. But she's never let us down, so we agreed.
reviews.title: Beautiful, charming and friendly hotel. I wish we had stayed longer!

likes.liked: — The location, the spacioousness of the room, the friendliness of the staff and the great food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was snowing when we landed in Zurich, but our rented Audi had snow tires, and off we went. We must have missed a turn, because instead of driving there on the motorway, we wound up on a two-lane road alonog the lake. It was so beautiful, and there was hardly any traffic. It took a little longer, but we found the hotel easily.
reviews.title: Going back but for AT LEAST a week!

likes.disliked: — The restaurant requires men to wear a jacket (although loaners are available)

reviews.text: And what a find! The Grand Hotel Quellenhof is just plain gorgeous. We were greeted warmly as we drove up and were whisked into the impressive lobby. A few minutes later we were in our room, a spacious Jr. Suite with a balcony overlooking the snow-filled grounds. A feeling of peace settled over us, and we were ready to stay forever.
reviews.title: ok but not top!
